channel.title: [PI] Colors?
channel.description:
[IMG]http://i51.tinypic.com/15yayht.png[/img]
I want it to show it in red text or something. I used my CP to do that, and it originally had @red@, @blu@, @yel@, @or1@, etc. in it, but it didn't work, so I took it out. It showed it as "[Alert] @red@TEST" instead of "[Alert] TEST. I want to add the colors @red@, @blu@, and all that stuff so it'll work. If not, is there any other ways I can add color to it?
Here's the color codes in my CP to select a color: (Btw, I took out the colors like I said to make it work better.)
[code]public String[] [] MESSAGE_COLORS = { {"Red",""}, {"Blue",""}, {"Green",""}, {"Yellow",""}, {"Magenta",""}, {"Orange",""}, {"Dark Red",""}, {"Dark Blue",""},[/code]
I didn't space it out because I can't use tabs, and I'm posting from my computer, while the server is being hosted on the VPS, which is where I code everything.
Here's the original:
[code]public String[] [] MESSAGE_COLORS = { {"Red","@red@"}, {"Blue","@blu@"}, {"Green","@gre@"}, {"Yellow","@yel@"}, {"Magenta","@mag@"}, {"Orange","@or1@"}, {"Dark Red","@drd"}, (Not sure, maybe @dkr@ or something.) {"Dark Blue","@dbl@"},[/code]

item.title: [PI] Colors?
item.dc:creator: @triger545 triger545
item.description:
@triger545 wrote:

I just thought that might have been the solution…

You might have to make the whole “colours” void in your client.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Nonamee wrote:

triger545:

Make sure your client knows what @blu@ or whatever is. I think you can do that in client.java.

That’s what I’m asking. How do I do that?

item.title: [PI] Colors?
item.dc:creator: @Nonamee Nonamee
item.description:
@Nonamee wrote:

I want it to show it in red text or something. I used my CP to do that, and it originally had @red@, @blu@, @yel@, @or1@, etc. in it, but it didn’t work, so I took it out. It showed it as “[Alert] @red@TEST” instead of "[Alert] TEST. I want to add the colors @red@, @blu@, and all that stuff so it’ll work. If not, is there any other ways I can add color to it?

Here’s the color codes in my CP to select a color: (Btw, I took out the colors like I said to make it work better.)

public String[] [] MESSAGE_COLORS = { {"Red",""}, {"Blue",""}, {"Green",""}, {"Yellow",""}, {"Magenta",""}, {"Orange",""}, {"Dark Red",""}, {"Dark Blue",""},

I didn’t space it out because I can’t use tabs, and I’m posting from my computer, while the server is being hosted on the VPS, which is where I code everything.

Here’s the original:

public String[] [] MESSAGE_COLORS = { {"Red","@red@"}, {"Blue","@blu@"}, {"Green","@gre@"}, {"Yellow","@yel@"}, {"Magenta","@mag@"}, {"Orange","@or1@"}, {"Dark Red","@drd"}, (Not sure, maybe @dkr@ or something.) {"Dark Blue","@dbl@"},
